alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Clark; Crawford; Grant; Jackson; Juneau; La Crosse; Monroe; Richland; Taylor; Trempealeau; Vernon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 05 at 4:02PM CST until January 05 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Blowing and Drifting Snow Continues... .While most of the accumulating snow has or will end across the area, wind gusts remain strong at times causing some blowing and drifting snow. This is especially true in open areas or ridge locations where snow may be blown aloft causing temporary reduction in visibilities. Drifts may cross roads at times too. Be careful near other vehicles or trucks that might stir up fresh snow causing temporary white out conditions as well. There will be travel impacts, including the afternoon commute. Plan now and check road conditions and the latest forecast before heading out. In addition, very cold wind chills will start to filter into the area. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of less than an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, southwest and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, 511mn.org in Minnesota, and 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.
